page.title: 05HISTORY OF TROWMILL
page.content: {HISTORY OF TROW MILL. { }DURING THE DURBULENT 1750'S THE WATERS OF THE RIVER TEVIOT WERE HARNESSED TO PROVIDE POWER TO DRIVE A WATER WHEEL WHICH ESTABLISHED TROW MILL AS A MEAL GRINDING MILL.THIS CONTINUED UNTIL AROUND 1880 WHEN WOOLLEN MANUFACTURE WAS STARTED AND THE MILL CONTINUED TO BE POWERED BY WATER UNTIL 1965 WHEN A MAJOR CHANGE OVER TO PLACE AND MAINS ELECRICITY WAS USED THROUGHOUT. ALL THIS WAS CONTAINED IN THE OLD STONE BUILDINGS ON THE SIDE OF THE RIVER BUT 1977 HERALDED A NEW MODERNISATION PROGRAM AND A NEW WEAVING FACTORY WAS BUILT AND AUTOMATIC RAPIER LOOMS INSTALLED AND THE OLD FACTORY GRADUALLY PHASED OUT.
